title._content: [Portrait of Bud Freeman and Marty Marsala, Jimmy Ryan's (Club), New York, N.Y., ca. July 1947] (LOC)

description._content: Gottlieb, William P., 1917-, photographer. [Portrait of Bud Freeman and Marty Marsala, Jimmy Ryan's (Club), New York, N.Y., ca. July 1947] 1 negative : b&w ; 2 1/4 x 2 1/4 in. Caption from Down Beat: A hot summer season is promised for New Yorkers, especially those around 52nd Street. Remember the report from the front last January that "Jazz Blows Final Breath?" Eddie Heywood, recently at the Downbeat club, is in the first picture. Coleman Hawkins, working at the Three Deuces, is shown in the second. Dardanelle, vibe star and leader of her own unit, can be seen at piano, framed by bass and guitar. The last shot shows tenorist Bud Freeman at Jimmy Ryan's. Notes: Gottlieb Collection Assignment No. 368 Reference print available in Music Division, Library of Congress. Purchase William P. Gottlieb Forms part of: William P. Gottlieb Collection (Library of Congress). In: "More who manage to keep New York's swing lane lively," Down Beat, v. 14, no. 16 (July 30, 1947), p. 3. Subjects: Freeman, Bud, 1906- Marsala, Marty Jazz musicians--1940-1950. Saxophonists--1940-1950. Fifty-second Street (New York, N.Y.)--1940-1950. Jimmy Ryan's (Club) Format: Portrait photographs--1940-1950. Group portraits--1940-1950. Film negatives--1940-1950. Rights Info: Mr. Gottlieb has dedicated these works to the public domain, but rights of privacy and publicity may apply. lcweb2.loc.gov/diglib/ihas/html/gottlieb/gottlieb-copyrig... Repository: (negative) Library of Congress, Prints & Photographs Division, Washington D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print (reference print) Library of Congress, Music Division, Washington D.C. 20540 USA, loc.gov/rr/perform/ Part Of: William P. Gottlieb Collection (DLC) 99-401005 General information about the Gottlieb Collection is available at lcweb2.loc.gov/diglib/ihas/html/gottlieb/gottlieb-home.html Persistent URL: hdl.loc.gov/loc.music/gottlieb.02951 Call Number: LC-GLB23- 0295
